New Records: New York Yankees returned to the ALCS for the record 19th time in franchise history.
Yankees relievers extended their scoreless streak to 15 2/3 innings this postseason.
Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole held the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings.
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning.
Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth inning.
Aaron Judge made a catch to secure the final out.
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees.
Michael Wacha allowed two runs, six hits, and a walk for Kansas City.
Gleyber Torres hit a double on the first pitch of the game.
Juan Soto followed with an RBI single on the third pitch of the night.
Anthony Volpe singled in the fifth inning.
Gleyber Torres lined a two-out single to make it 2-0.
Giancarlo Stanton extended the lead to 3-0 with a single in the sixth.
Bobby Witt Jr. had a base hit in the sixth inning.
Vinnie Pasquantino had an RBI double.
Gerrit Cole got Salvador Perez to pop out to end the sixth inning.
Gerrit Cole ended his night after getting Kyle Isbel to fly out to the warning track with a runner aboard to end the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees will play Cleveland or Detroit in the ALCS starting Monday night at Yankee Stadium.
The Royals made their first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series.
There is hope in Kansas City with young stars such as Bobby Witt Jr. signed to long-term deals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years.
Tensions boiled over in the sixth inning when Anthony Volpe slapped a hard tag on Maikel Garcia, leading to players spilling out of both dugouts before order was restored.
